pr_title: SQL: Fix JDBC url pattern in docs and error message

timeline.message:
SQL: Fix JDBC url pattern in docs and error message

The docs pattern url was using `*` which means zero or many instead
of `?` which means zero or one. The pattern url returned in error
messages was not in sync with the one in the docs.

Fixes: #56476

timeline.bodyText: ? means zero ore one in regex, which is what we want, but how can we differentiate from the [?[option...] which is the actual char ? ? In the error message I used \?, but not sure. Any suggestions?
timeline.author: matriv
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -51,7 +51,7 @@ Once registered, the driver understands the following syntax as an URL:
 
 ["source","text",subs="attributes"]
 ----
-jdbc:es://[[http|https]://]*[host[:port]]*/[prefix]*<[?[option=value]&]*
+jdbc:es://[[http|https]://]?[host[:port]]?/[prefix]?[?[option=value]&]*

replies.bodyText: For 0 or 1 (or ?) there is also the {0,1} more explicit notation, but I am not sure if we want to complicate things...
replies.author: astefan

timeline.message: fixup! SQL: Fix JDBC url pattern in docs and error message
